social_posts.post_text:
I left social media to focus on my fertility journey for well over a year. So I am thrilled to share I am back on here joyous, after a horrific, painful, soul-crushing, & exhausting journey that was faced with much suffering. 

I couldn’t be more relieved to officially be in my second trimester starting today -what timing- and announce that @nickolacka and I are expecting a little one in early Summer 2023!!! No clue on the gender and we could really care less, all we want is a happy and healthy baby. 

I am still dealing with PTSD after years of infertility & more IVF procedures than I care to count, so please understand I need more time to process years of loss & grief before I share my journey or answer fertility questions. The only way through the hell of the last years of infertility was for me to put blinders on and laser focus on the next step forward. And I will continue to stay laser focused on the future while I work on processing the years of struggle privately, and plan for a magical new year ahead. 

For all of the incomparably strong, brave, and terrified women fighting complex infertility (especially those fighting at least 2-3 failed IVF cycles) I know how much abject pain and suffering you are in, and how these announcements feel like a burning knife plunged into your heart. I see you, I feel you, and I share in your pain, loss, disappointment and isolation. 

My two pieces of advice for infertility warriors is to stop numbering days, counting the losses, instead focus on the outcome you want -a healthy baby. It will happen, not on your timeline or in anyway that comes easy to others, but it will happen. Oh and don’t expect others to understand… like war, complex infertility can only be experienced to be truly understood. 

Thank you to all of my inspiring #lymefighters @thehealhive who despite their own struggles so graciously supported my journey to motherhood, & to all of my cherished friends who gave me space to process loss w/o taking it personally & gave us unconditional love & support throughout these trying years. 

Brian and I wish you a beautiful and hopeful new year ahead. Here is the most wanted & loved baby 🐝 coming in 2023!!! 🍾

I remember a Valentine's feeling so sorry for myself I couldn't imagine a future. I wasn't useful anymore. I was a middle-aged, single, lonely, & sick person. I got bit by a tick. I was 35, unable to get out of bed. My life savings fell like sand through a sped-up hourglass.  The future & love looked bleak.
⠀
Did I give up? Nearly.
⠀
My husband met me while I was still very sick. Within the 1st month of our evolving friendship, I became so ill I was fighting for my life in the hospital.
He showed up for me. He never left my side.
⠀
I didn't realize at the time I had met someone who was truly worthy of my heart. It took time & trust.
⠀
I also had to begin to believe in myself, in my ability to transform over & over again like a Phoenix rising from the ashes.
⠀
Sickness changed me. It caused me to devalue people & work that was not satisfying my heart.
⠀
It also caused me to value the most important things in life: unconditional love, loyalty, perseverance, & truth.
⠀
Life wasn't easy when I met my husband. We lost our first baby. It took 7 yrs to get to where we are today. We have been through moments that break most couples.
⠀
I hate what Lyme did. I wish Lyme hadn't cost me most of my fertile years, or Celiac disease & pernicious anemia.
⠀
But I found love because I didn't let sickness define me. Through fighting chronic illness I found the strength within to become the best version of myself. Chronic illness allowed me to love myself. I couldn't love properly until I loved myself first.
⠀
On V Day don’t look at your age, what you have lost, or all you have missed out on, but look at how to better love yourself.
⠀
Today I am 44. Healthy AF. Married to the most amazing human w/ a baby due in 4 months.
⠀
None of this happened on an expected timeline. The ability to love & find love never ends if you are open.
⠀
You can transform your life & attitude at any moment. Comparisons are self-inflicted paper cuts on your heart. Don't compare, love yourself first. Lyme & infertility taught me that.
⠀
This Valentine's Day please give yourself the gift of unconditional love.
⠀
The rest follows.
⠀
I love you @nickolacka

Even where there is success and joy there can also be extreme loss. I’ve never fully told my story.
⠀
I’ve been reluctant to share my experience as trauma, miscarriage & disappointment was every step of the way.
⠀
This is the 1st time I’ve felt strong enough to share that 8 yrs ago I was pregnant w/ my first daughter. We lost her when I was 4 months pregnant. I still had Lyme disease but undiagnosed #celiac disease & #perniciousanemia was to blame for the end of that dream.
⠀
That first loss began to eat at my soul like a flesh eating disease. It necrotized my ability to believe others joy could ever truly be in my future.
⠀
I spent the next 2y after that first loss ensuring that  bee venom therapy fully eradicated #chroniclyme #babesia and #bartonella; fixing my broken gut & severe nerve damage.
⠀
Once I healed & was physically healthy to carry again, the next blow being diagnosed w/ complex fertility problems at 40 only brought more misery & moments of hopelessness.
⠀
The fear I would never became pregnant again took over my brain and body. The fear only grew as each #ivffailure & multiple miscarriages became the new normal.
⠀
For years as I was building @thehealhive I helped members & friends get pregnant. It kept never happening for me. Those who easily got pregnant didn’t comprehend the enormity of many losses. Then societal expectations & the dread ticking time clock of age sullied all joy. I came off social media. Isolated from most of my friends. The only way to survive was burying my head & spirit into work & just putting one foot in front of the other.
⠀
It really became a situation where every hope became a miscarriage. Every good egg retrieval had a doctor error being made.
⠀
It was truly torture.
⠀
Then I got pregnant this fall —twins! Hope at last!
⠀
Not so fast. I lost one of my babies at 9 weeks. Again, joy temp crushed by the death of dreams.
⠀
So I hope you now understand why I’ve not been on here, why I kept so quiet during pregnancy. The trauma has been real & deep.
⠀
But this baby girl is so very healthy and so am I. So I’m here sharing in my last few days.
⠀
Hope can be a faint glimmer of light but if there never ever give up.
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀

Today is a special day for my husband and I. On July 4th, 2015 -as new friends- we lit a sky lantern and I used every bit of my being to make one wish… to one day find the love of my life and create a family. (See story)
⠀
Fast forward eight years to July 4, 2023 and after we tragically lost our first daughter seven long years ago —after years of stupefying sacrifice and endless, heartbreaking loss—that wish made 8 years ago has finally come true.
⠀
So we are overjoyed to finally, finally, finally, be able to introduce you to the most magical being… Beckett Astríd Bustamantè.
⠀
Born healthy and happy on Friday, June 30th at 6:03 am, in Napa, California, at 7lbs 2ounces and 20.5 inches!
⠀
The name Beckett means both “little Brook” as well as “bee hive” —there really wasn’t another name more fitting for our dear daughter.
⠀
Astríd means divinely beautiful and beloved of the gods. It is a name that I picked out when I was 15 if I ever had a daughter, it just took some time. While Bustamantè is her paternal family name honoring her strong and proud Mexican heritage.
⠀
Beckett was born vaginally after a long and difficult 33 hour labor with two hours of active pushing, surrounded by her Dad, her amazing midwife @wildwomanwellness , our skilled doctor and an incredible team of labor and delivery nurses.
⠀
Being pregnant at 44 brings many fears. Staying pregnant after so many losses was fraught with risks and endless worries.
⠀
So to have the healthiest and happiest little 5 day babe in my arms is truly a dream come true that no words can capture. I can’t stop shedding happy tears. It is unreal.
⠀
All I can say is make a wish today in the rockets red glare, but if you want it to come true, sometimes a lot of work and never giving up hope is the true magic.
⠀
Thank you to all of our dear friends and family;  my @thehealhive team and such supportive members; and this community here, for always cheerleading through the toughest times.
⠀
Forever grateful, I can now say I’m finally a Momma to the most beloved and wanted baby girl.
⠀
Dreams do come true.
After eight hard fought years, I finally get to post on National Daughters Day. Happy day my darling daughter. You are my sunshine, my heart, my everything. (Made with @nickolacka)

I will allow those with more expertise and firsthand experience speak to the recent atrocities and horrors committed in Israel. But I stand with every friend and family affected by the senseless slaughter of innocents. We are no closer to peace than when I was born. I hope beyond hope during my daughters lifetime this changes. My heartbreaks every second. War affects innocents on all sides, but terrorism and religious hate whether it’s on our own soil in the States or overseas, can not be permitted to continue.

WHAT IS THE HEAL HIVE COMMUNITY?

Our online course, #BVTBootcamp, requires our members to make big changes….

But you’ll never have to make them alone @thehealhive! 

[SAVE to read later or SHARE this with someone who could use support on their Lyme-healing journey!]

Not only will you be paired with your very own Heal Hive Peer Mentor (such as our bee-loved @audrey_lambidakis!), but you’ll also gain access to our cherished community of badass Lyme fighters — and alumni Lyme survivors — who will cheer you on every step of the way.

We’ve found the community support in our members-only platform to be so powerful, that 70% of our graduates say it was not only essential to their success in Bootcamp, but their ability to complete the full protocol.

We are ALWAYS #StrongestAsAHive, and we can’t wait for you to join ours.

Click the link in our bio to add your name to our waitlist (invites for the next semester are going out before the end of the year!), and be sure to give Heal Hive Peer Mentor @audrey_lambidakis a follow for a front row seat to her success at the Hive!
Wait for it… 20 weeks starting tomorrow and Baby B couldn’t be happier or more excited to master every step of babyhood. Forever grateful to be blessed with this magical being.

I wish I could say this is my first baby. But she is not… Beckett is my second daughter.
‌
I lost my first daughter eight years ago when I was still battling Lyme disease due to autoimmune complications.
‌
After the tragic loss of my first daughter, I was forced to reconsider when and should I ever get pregnant again. All I wanted and wished for was a healthy baby —and a healthy self.
‌
Beckett means “beehive” (and also Little Brook 🥹) and her name symbolizes the importance of how she came to “bee”.
‌
Not only did I have a healthy pregnancy at 45 years old… but I have thrived after pregnancy, since both myself and my baby continue to be so strong and healthy.
‌
I absolutely credit bee venom immunotherapy for fully eradicating my Post Treatment (what used to be known as Late Stage) Lyme disease and allowing me to bring Beckett into the world free of congenital Lyme. Everyday is a gift and I appreciate every second of motherhood —hard won and worth every tear to get here. I wouldn’t change anything.
‌
Dr Charles Ray Jones, a trailblazing pediatric Lyme doctor, studied 102 live births to mothers with Lyme disease. His most common findings were 80% of children had cognitive problems, learning difficulties, and mood swings. 72% had fatigue and lack of stamina.
‌
Developing babies are at risk for contracting Lyme in utero, but they can also be infected by breastmilk.
‌
Wondering why I am so passionate about bee venom immunotherapy?
‌
You know what they say, a picture is worth a thousand words…
‌
Curious about Dr Charles Ray Jones and his research on pediatric Lyme disease? Have questions about bee venom immunotherapy?
‌
Feel free to ask ⬇️
‌
‌

‌

CHRONIC LYME DISEASE IS A MYTH?! 🤦🏼‍♀️💚

Spreading scientific misinformation is pretty scientifically biased in my opinion…

Late Stage/Persistent/or what is now being called #PostTreatmentLymeDisease is real. 

Shame on anyone spreading misinformation & lies that it doesn’t exist. 😡😤

It has already been scientifically proven in *multiple* research studies that antibiotics do not guarantee Lyme disease is thoroughly treated. 

[SAVE this post for later OR SHARE it far & wide so that we can end this harmful myth, once and for all. 💚]

A 2008 study treated mice infected w/ Lyme disease & then had ticks, free of Lyme disease, feed on the mice after antibiotic treatment. 

Guess what happened? 

The ticks became infected with active Lyme, proving that Lyme can be persistent despite antibiotics. 

In October of this year, Czech scientists dissected the brain of a man who was told after multiple years of antibiotic treatment that he didn’t still have Lyme. 

The man sadly committed suicide & his final wish was to donate his brain to science to prove the Lyme was still active. 

He was right, the scientists found 2 active forms of Lyme disease in his brain & they were able to infect mice with that same bacteria. 

Yet again proving the Lyme can persist despite multiple rounds of Antibiotics & years of therapy. 

@unbiasedscipod you are ignorantly ignoring the CDC does acknowledges chronic Lyme.

A cursory look at scientific research into Lyme would have debunked your claims that late stage #Lymedisease can be treated by antibiotics. 

And THANK YOU to organizations like @globallymealliance @ilads.lyme @generation_lyme @lymetimes @projectlyme and @iseainonprofit for supporting, advocating for & VALIDATING the Lyme community. 

PS: Dr Jessica Steiner & Dr. Andrea Love sell merchandise on their website & advertising on their for-profit podcast. They have a non-profit arm but that is not their IG nor their podcast. They also have a disclaimer acknowledging that their information is not necessarily complete or accurate. No kidding -insert eye roll 🙄.

What are your thoughts on @unbiasedscipod’s recent campaign to undermine the validity of a #ChronicLyme diagnosis?

Finally! The CDC updated their website to reflect ongoing research and data that finally recognizes what thousands of people and educated healthcare providers already know —chronic (late stage or post treatment) Lyme Disease is very real. 

Chronic Lyme is now a CDC recognized chronic disease. It shouldn’t have taken so long to come to be, as research has proven for years that the bacteria that is Lyme disease does the following: morphs forms; in some cases becomes stronger with antibiotics; allows persister bacteria cells to flourish; and creates bacterial biofilms that keep the bacteria hidden from most protocols, among more insidious ways it hides from the immune system and thwarts antibiotics. 

I urge you not to allow nefarious actors parading as doctors or scientists, refute basic science and real knowledge the CDC is publishing. 

Misinformation is rampant in our era. There are bad actors everywhere, but those afflicted by chronic Lyme and the doctors who actually treat them fought long and hard for the research to meet the recognition. 

Treating chronic Lyme disease and other tick borne infections has ways to go and with anything, is ripe for exploitation. But that shouldn’t discourage the voices of people who are healing, who have successfully treated chronic Lyme, and have fought hard for this moment. 

Speak up. Speak loudly. Spread science and facts —not disinformation. 

There is hope. I am not a victim of chronic Lyme but a healthy survivor who has dedicated her life to helping others become success stories. 

If I can go on to live a healthy life Lyme free, anyone can.

#congentiallyme #invisibleillness #spoonielife #spooniewarrior #spoonies #spoonieproblems #spooniesupport #chronicillness #chronicillnesswarrior #healhivesuccessstory #chronicpainwarrior #mecfs #chronicfatiguesyndrome #chronicneurologicallyme #lymedisease #lymediseaseawareness #lymedontkillmyvibe#lymewarrior#multiplesclerosis #bvt #beevenomtherapy #bvtforlyme #apitherapy #mastcellactivationdisorder #fibromyalgiawarrior #healhive #thehealhive #healhivenutritionalprotocol #bvtbootcamp #healhivesystem

Not only does chronic Lyme disease exist, according to the CDC, but it also nearly killed me —if it wasn’t for bee venom immunotherapy I wouldn’t be alive today. 

I am passionate about Lyme advocacy for those still sickened & living on the fringes of society: Due to the masses of healthcare workers still uneducated about late stage Lyme disease & other tick born illnesses. 

Most doctors do not know that tick bites can transmit Lyme disease & other debilitating (and in some cases fatal) diseases in a short time —ticks do NOT have to be attached for 24 hrs to transmit. In some cases they can transmit in 15 minutes, in the case of Powassan. 

Most doctors are not educated that once Lyme disease is late stage, antibiotics usually just make the disease worsen symptoms & cause more suffering. 

Most doctors have zero idea that bee venom immunotherapy is being studied the world over due to its undeniable health benefits including: Antibacterial, antiviral, anti-parasitical, anti-fungal, neuro protective, & chemotherapeutic, among so much more. 

Most doctors do not know that bee venom has been studied at the University of New Haven showing that it outperforms multiple types & concurrent antibiotics shown in in-vitro studies. 

Most doctors think that late stage Lyme disease is all in one’s head —they are right and wrong. Lyme bacteria has been found in multiple research studies to persist inside victims brains, despite years of antibiotics and other western and eastern medicine protocols. Bee venom crosses the blood-brain barrier allowing for the success of those who use it correctly. 

There are amazing doctors treating those with chronic illness. My life has also been saved by smart, educated, compassionate doctors who took me seriously & helped me on my journey back to thriving. 

But don’t let the misjudgments of uneducated physicians allow you to be gas light nor dissuade you from doing bee venom immunotherapy. 

#chroniclyme #healhivesuccessstory #spooniewarrior

Nine years ago today, I was so sick I carried an IV pole w/ me to a weekend away, I didn’t expect that weekend to change the trajectory of my life. 

I didn’t want to go on this trip. I was in no mood to be social. I was in massive pain from rheumatoid arthritis and fibromyalgia. I was beyond fatigued from chronic fatigue syndrome and Babesia. However, I was so depressed from fighting Lyme disease to no avail, that I knew laying in bed all weekend would be even worse for my mental health.

I was friends with everyone coming that weekend —but one guy. When the guy first walked in, he first saw me in front of the fireplace, hooked up to an IV pole. I said hi and we began talking about health and cancer. 

How that started a love affair that would span 9 years, you tell me, but I’m ever grateful that my through richer and poorer, and through sickness and health, @nickolacka has never left my side. 

Happy Anniversary darling. It’s been 9 years today since Cupid flew through a snowstorm to grace us with unconditional love. 

Never say no to life, despite its particular challenges and what feels like insurmountable hurdles. You never know who you will meet. 

#congentiallyme #invisibleillness #spoonielife #spooniewarrior #spoonies #spoonieproblems #spooniesupport #chronicillness #chronicillnesswarrior #healhivesuccessstory #chronicpainwarrior #mecfs #chronicfatiguesyndrome #chronicneurologicallyme #lymedisease #lymediseaseawareness #lymedontkillmyvibe#lymewarrior#multiplesclerosis #bvt #beevenomtherapy #bvtforlyme #apitherapy #mastcellactivationdisorder #fibromyalgiawarrior #healhive #thehealhive #healhivenutritionalprotocol #bvtbootcamp #healhivesystem

I never expected the worst thing to happen to me to become the richest gift I’ve ever received. 

I feel so blessed that I was able to transform my health, but the true gift I’ve been granted is the ability to help others transform theirs —& regain their life back. 

When I was sick & debilitated from chronic Lyme disease, I remember telling my close friends in all sincerity, “I wouldn’t wish this hell on my worst enemy.” And to this day, I truly believe that chronic Lyme is one of the worst personal health conditions one can experience because it’s just not Lyme. It’s the 50-100 symptoms it causes. It’s the breakdown of all of our bodies systems. It’s the insidious breakdown of one’s mental health day after day. It’s the denial by health care workers. It’s the denials by insurance for basics that would be covered by any other disease. 

Chronic Lyme is the end of the life you knew before. But it doesn’t have to be the end of one’s life —it in fact can be the rebirth of a stronger, healthier and happier person than ever before. 

So with immense gratitude to all of the Lyme and chronic illness warriors who put their trust and care into my hands everyday, thank you for believing in me, thank you for trusting that good science and common sense is a recipe for health, thank you for believing in the beautiful, positive community we’ve built together, thank you for trusting bee venom immunotherapy efficacy, and thank you for believing in YOU -in your strength despite horrific pain; in your power despite crippling fatigue; in your grace despite losing your most precious gift of life… time; and thank you for showing yourself that life can be as sweet as honey if you put in the hard work. 

If you know anyone struggling with a variety of health conditions w/ no answers in sight. If you know someone stuck in endless Lyme treatments. If you know someone battling mold exposure or poor digestive health… I would be honored to help them also regain their life back. 

Start with @thehealhive for Comprehensive LabCorp Testing looking at over 90+ bio markers including inflammation, mold, hormones, lipids, metabolic, adrenal, autoimmune, etc… 

Tag a friend in need ⬇️

The greatest gift of all this season is my precious Beckett. I feel such gratitude and joy -and disbelief- words mostly fail me. I think these pictures encapsulate all of our happiness and bliss ➡️

If you’ve been following me or know me well, you know how many holidays have been fraught with Lyme or fertility issues… to be able to celebrate with everyone bursting in good health and cheer is such a blessing and I’m soaking up every second. 

Wishing you and yours the merriest of holidays and sending love from my little family to yours.
